intro: Machaerina monocarpa, commonly known as the solitary fruit machaerina, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its unique, solitary fruit that develops from a single flower. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, with a distinct serrated margin. Machaerina monocarpa is typically found in coastal and inland forested areas, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
